results.title: Steam Trains of Australia
results.brief_description: Trains, their stories, the people, the railways and the country itself are featured in this delightful video which includes vintage footage of Australian steam trains of the past.
results.description: Trains, their stories, the people, the railways and the country itself are featured in this delightful video which includes vintage footage of Australian steam trains of the past.

results.title: Steam days: Travels with a Duchess and the fishing line
results.creator_credit: BBC, Peter Walton and Neil Cameron
results.brief_description: Presented by Miles Kington, dedicated enthusiast, this celebration of the steam age looks at some of the great British engines, travels the famous lines and meets the wonderfully eccentric people who keep steam alive in Britain today. “Travels with a Duchess” looks at The Duchess of Hamilton, one of the most famous passenger trains built in the 1930s. “The Fishing Line” travels the fishing line from Fort William to Malliag, built to transport herring at the end of the nineteenth century.

results.title: Steam days 2
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, Neil Cameron and Peter Walton
results.brief_description: Another delightful program for lovers of steam trains and travel. Two episodes featured. “Workhorses” covers the history of steam freight trains in Britain. Miles Kington reflects fondly on the unsung heroes of the railways. “Going Great Western” takes us on the Great Western Railway, which opened the so-called Cornish Riviera to travellers in the Victorian era. Features beautiful West Country scenery.

results.title: Steam at war: the home front
results.brief_description: Using footage from three classic wartime railway short films- ‘Carrying the Load’, ‘Necessary Journey’ and ‘Southern on Service’, this tape profiles Britain’s railways during the tumultuous Second World War. It covers a gamut of wartime operations, including troop and freight trains carrying men and munitions, Luftwaffe raids on railways, mobile hospital carriages, rail mounted anti-aircraft guns on the Romney, Hythe and Dymchurch narrow-gauge railway, the naming ceremony of the ‘Home Guard’ loco, plus many other memorable moments. Also included on the tape is exclusive footage of the North Yorkshire Moors Railway ‘Steam at War’ weekend. A weekend which is noted for its recreation of the sights and sounds of wartime steam on the home front.

results.title: Stealing beauty
results.creator_credit: Jeremy Thomas, Recorded Picture Company, UGC Images, Fox Searchlight and Bernardo Bertolucci
results.brief_description: Nineteen-year-old Lucy (Liv Tyler) goes to stay in the Tuscan countryside with old friends of her late mother. This is a time of discovery for Lucy: inspired by the free-spirit of the bohemian characters who take special interest in her virginity (or loss of), she explores a romance with a local Italian boy. Her mentor is Alex (Jeremy Irons), who is a writer on the brink of death. Bertolucci is pre-occupied with aesthetics in this film and the focus is very much on the beauty of the Tuscan countryside, and of Liv Tyler. Cast includes Sinead Cusack, Jean Marais, Donal McCann, Stefania Sandrelli, Joseph Fiennes.

results.title: Steady as she goes
results.creator_credit: Sharon Lee Chapelle, ONF | NFB and Robert Fresco
results.brief_description: George Fulfit, retired, illustrates with humor and optimism the delicate craft of putting ships into bottles. The film documents the construction of the largest ship he has ever built. More than a “how-to” film, this short documentary shows the very real contribution a craft can make to anyone’s life, whether a child, or a working or retired person. (Awards: Toronto; New York; Columbus; Yorkton; Carbondale; Toulon.)

results.title: Steady
results.creator_credit: Herman Van Der Horst and Cinetone Studios
results.brief_description: Impressions, without commentary, of the city of Rotterdam, which was devastated in 1940. The city is a living organism whose heart was torn away by the brute force of war. Among the ruins a new life has started up - in the docks, among the bombed-out ruins men are at work. In a mighty symphony of labour, the new city arises from the bomb sites and the dark ruins of old Rotterdam.

results.title: Staying upfront
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubetzki, Film Australia and Stephen Ramsey
results.brief_description: This is a film about a long distance owner truck driver and his family. The reasons why he became an owner-driver are explored as well as the rewards he gets from it, and the effect on his family of operating in a high pressure, often marginal income industry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Rubetzki, Film Australia and Stephen Ramsey

results.title: Staying number one: The Swingers
results.creator_credit: John Cruthers, Ray Argall and Musical Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Pop Movie”.
Follows the quest for fame and fortune by the New Zealand rock group, “The Swingers”, in Australia starting with their hit ‘Counting the Beat’ and tracing them through their involvement with the feature film ‘Starstruck’, to their eventual break-up in mid 1982. Includes interviews with promoter Michael Gudinski, the group’s manager, and “The Swingers” themselves as well as several promotion clips.
